message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this great product! I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not sure I can go that high.  Would you be willing to sell it to me for $85?  I think that's a fair price for both of us.
I appreciate your offer, Bob, but I was thinking more along the lines of $92. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this sale.

Alice, I understand you need to make a profit, but $92 is still a bit too high for me. How about we split the difference and settle on $88?  I'm really interested in this product, and I think this price is a fair compromise.

I can see you're really interested in the product, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, I'm not quite ready to meet you at $88 just yet. I'll meet you halfway from $92, so I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.50. This is my final offer, but I'm willing to negotiate further if you're willing to meet me at this price.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $90.50 is still a bit out of my price range.  I'm happy to meet you halfway again, and I'm willing to pay $89.25 for the product.  This is my final offer, and I'm confident it's fair for both of us.

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I've already met you halfway from $90.50 and then from $92. I'm not willing to go any lower than $90. I think this is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you. If you're still interested, I'm willing to sell it to you at this price.
